Issues.Title: fix(http): better handle unexpected `undefined` XSRF tokens
Issues.Body:
`HttpXsrfTokenExtractor` allows returning `string|null` for an XSRF token, and the interceptor checked if the returned token is `null`. However, some implementations return `undefined` instead (behind an `any`) type, which caused the interceptor to crash when trying to set an `undefined` value for the header.

This commit makes the XSRF interceptor a little more resilient against such broken implementations of the `HttpXsrfTokenExtractor` interface.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(http): better handle unexpected `undefined` XSRF tokens" (#47683)

Issues.Title: refactor(docs-infra): add new Input for better description of close button in notification component
Issues.Body:
Problem: 
The close icon on the announcement should read "Close {description of banner}", this is a reusable component.

Solution proposal:
Add a new input for banner description with default value, allowing the insertion of other descriptions and if nothing is passed, it assumes a default value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(docs-infra): add new Input for better description of close button in notification component" (#47681)

Issues.Title: perf(compiler-cli): minimize filesystem calls when generating shims
Issues.Body: Previously when a file was being analyzed to determine if a shim should be generated, up to two calls to the host `fileExists` function per file per generator were made. In the default host, each `fileExists` call made two underlying file system calls. Following these calls, the file was then read via `getSourceFile`. However, `getSourceFile` will return `undefined` if the requested file does not exist. As a result, `getSourceFile` can be used directly to request both potential file names and leverage the return value to determine if the file does not exist. This avoids the need to call `fileExists` at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(compiler-cli): minimize filesystem calls when generating shims" (#47682)

Issues.Title: `$localize` is not found after `ng add` with cli v15.0.0-next.4 and ng v15.0.0-next.5
Issues.Body:
### Command

add

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.5

### Description

Angular v15.0.0-next.5 contains the fix from @alan-agius4 to properly add the `@angular/localize` polyfill in a CLI app now that the `polyfills.ts` file is gone. https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/400a6b5e3707f3939d84c659a115b75ef15d2c09

The polyfill is added when running `ng add`, but it looks like using `$localize` still doesn't work.

```
Error: src/app/app.component.ts:9:11 - error TS2304: Cannot find name '$localize'.

9   title = $localize`i18n-next`;
```

### Minimal Reproduction

```
npx @angular/cli@15.0.0-next.4 new i18n-next --defaults
cd i18n-next
npm i
ng add @angular/localize@15.0.0-next.5 --skip-confirmation
```

then update `app.component.ts` with:
```ts
title = $localize`i18n-next`;
```

and run:
```
ng extract-i18n --output-path src/locale/
```

The same repro using the stable release of the CLI and fwk works out of the box.


### Exception or Error

```text
Error: src/app/app.component.ts:9:11 - error TS2304: Cannot find name '$localize'.

9   title = $localize`i18n-next`;
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.0.0-next.4
Node: 16.17.0
Package Manager: npm 6.14.17
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 15.0.0-next.5
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1500.0-next.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.0.0-next.4
@angular-devkit/core            15.0.0-next.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.0.0-next.4
@angular/cli                    15.0.0-next.4
@schematics/angular             15.0.0-next.4
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.7.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`$localize` is not found after `ng add` with cli v15.0.0-next.4 and ng v15.0.0-next.5" (#47677)

Issues.Title: Grouping providers for lazy loaded standalone component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

**Case:**
One standalone component which is lazy loaded uses multiple services. Each of those should have new instance every time lazy loaded component is loaded and they have to be in the same scope to be able to use one another and share some other data (by other providers). 

**Current solution:**
Right now you can either explicitly provide those in `providers` section of component which is not ideal since it require to add every single provider (service) there each time you create a new one. 
Before standalone components you could also create an empty NgModule and use it as `providedIn: MyNgModule` in service decorator and then simply add one provider to your module which of course still works with standalone components but requirers you to use NgModule. 

**Problem:**
Since `providedIn: NgModule` will be deprecated I think it would be nice to came up with some grouping mechanizm so decorators in standalone lazy loaded components would not be blown out of proportion. 

### Proposed solution

One possible solution could be to use `providedIn: InjectionToken` or something like that and then be able to provide just this token into component decorator. 

### Alternatives considered

n/d
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Grouping providers for lazy loaded standalone component" (#47672)

Issues.Title: feat(core): introduce EnvironmentProviders wrapper type
Issues.Body:
feat(core): introduce EnvironmentProviders wrapper type

This commit introduces a new type `EnvironmentProviders` which can be used
in contexts where Angular accepted `Provider`s destined for
`EnvironmentInjector`s. This includes contexts such as `@NgModule.providers`
and `Route.providers`.

The new type is useful for preventing such providers from accidentally
ending up in `@Component.providers`. It can be used as the return type of
provider functions (such as `provideRouter`) to enforce this safety.

Because `Provider` allows `any[]` nested arrays, the compile-time safety
provided by `EnvironmentProviders` is easily circumvented. However, the
runtime shape of `EnvironmentProviders` is not compatible with component
injectors and will result in a runtime error if it leaks through (NG0207).

A new function `makeEnvironmentProviders` is used to construct this new type
from an array of providers.

The existing `importProvidersFrom` operation previously returned a very
similar type `ImportedNgModuleProviders` which had the same goal. This
machinery is switched over to use the new `EnvironmentProviders` interface
instead (in fact, `ImportedNgModuleProviders` is now just an alias to
`EnvironmentProviders`).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(core): introduce EnvironmentProviders wrapper type" (#47669)

Issues.Title: Useless installation of temporary CLI
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I'm not sure if this should be a bug or a feature, it's more of an annoyance.

Every week when I check with 'ng update' it first complains that the CLI is outdated and starts installing a temporary CLI version, which takes a while. Then it tells me there is a new CLI version and I have to install it again with 'ng update @angular/cli', this time for real. Next time I do a 'ng update' it quickly shows me, without the delay.

Is it really necessary to install a new temporary cli version every week ?

Or maybe if there is a new one, can't we have question or a parameter to install the new CLI version (automatically), instead of installing it temporarily (and thus twice)? Just like when you type 'ng new' you also get a question.

### Minimal Reproduction

> ng update

The installed Angular CLI version is outdated.
Installing a temporary Angular CLI versioned 14.2.5 to perform the update.
 Packages successfully installed.

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 14.2.5
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.3.0
OS: win32 x64
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Useless installation of temporary CLI" (#24024)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): skip downloading temp CLI when running `ng update` without package names
Issues.Body:
In the case when `ng update` is ran without a package name, an update is not be performed. In this case using the current installed version of the CLI is good enough.

Closes #24024
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): skip downloading temp CLI when running `ng update` without package names" (#24028)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): remove leftover schematics path handling
Issues.Body: Remove interim handling of `"format": "path"`. workingDirectory smart default provider should be used instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/cli): remove leftover schematics path handling" (#24006)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use high resolution time for esbuild builder completion time
Issues.Body: Update the build time calculation for the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder to use the `process.hrtime` time source.  The high resolution time provides a more accurate time source and allows for nanosecond level timings if needed.  Currently the console output is rounded to the nearest millisecond. Future performance monitoring capabilities may leverage the more fine-grained values.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use high resolution time for esbuild builder completion time" (#24029)

Issues.Title: Update Angular to 15.0.0-next.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update Angular to 15.0.0-next.5" (#24027)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid extra babel file reads in esbuild builder rebuilds
Issues.Body: To further improve incremental rebuild performance of the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, the output of JS file babel transformations are now cached in memory by the input file name and invalidated via the file watching events. This allows an additional file read per JS input file to be avoided if the file has not changed. Previously the content of the JS input file was used as the basis of the cache key for the transformation output which necessitated reading the file. With the file change information available, the content based method is no longer necessary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid extra babel file reads in esbuild builder rebuilds" (#24018)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): add support for Node.js version 18
Issues.Body:
Pacote version 14 does requires `14.17.x` or `16.13.x`.

BREAKING CHANGE: The Angular CLI  no longer supports `16.10.x`, `16.11.x` and `16.12.x`. Current supported versions of Node.js are `14.20.x`, `16.13.x` and `18.10.x`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/cli): add support for Node.js version 18" (#24026)

Issues.Title: angular-devkit failing on calling other rules that returns a Tree
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.1.3

### Description

Hello dear maintainers,

With the recent refactoring on the @angular-devkit/schematics [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/398d66af4fd7fe5bcb0161428d832de1c228d16c), calling an external schematic that works by itself without problems where it returns a Tree as Rule fails with searching with the in operator inside a Symbol.

### Minimal Reproduction

Unfortunately, this is not really CLI related but related to a custom schematic that our company uses.

TypeError: Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'Symbol(schematic-tree)' in null
    at callRuleAsync (/home/cenk/development/work/nx-test/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:89:32)


 >  NX   Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'Symbol(schematic-tree)' in null


TypeError: Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'Symbol(schematic-tree)' in null
    at callRuleAsync (/home/cenk/development/work/nx-test/node_modules/@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/call.js:89:32)
```
```

"@angular-devkit/architect": "^0.1402.4",

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): throw more relevant error when Rule returns invalid null value
Issues.Body:
A `null` value is not considered a valid return value for a schematics Rule. Previously, this
would accidently be treated the same as a void return due to incomplete result checking.
However, recent refactoring caused the `null` case to fail with a non-obvious error message when
it should have failed with the existing `InvalidRuleResultException`. Non-tree result objects
including `null` will now fail with `InvalidRuleResultException`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): throw more relevant error when Rule returns invalid null value" (#24016)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add initial incremental code rebuilding to esbuild builder
Issues.Body: The experimental esbuild-based browser application builder will now support incremental JavaScript bundling when run in watch mode via the `watch` option. This initial implementation integrates the esbuild incremental rebuild functionality. TypeScript source file caching has also been added to improve the rebuild initialization time for the TypeScript and Angular compilation steps. This initial support is not yet fully optimized and additional work is planned to further improve the rebuild performance.

Issues.Title: Option to do not override "target" and "useDefineForClassFields"
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Description

There are reasons why you've added this warning:
```
TypeScript compiler options "target" and "useDefineForClassFields" are set to "ES2022" and "false" respectively by the Angular CLI. To control ECMA version and features use the Browerslist configuration. For more information, see https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist
```

> To control ECMA version and features use the Browerslist configuration

There is no way to define `target` and `useDefineForClassFields` in the Browerslist configuration.

Please provide some option to skip `target` and `useDefineForClassFields` overriding - some projects are not ready for ES2022 and they are too big to modify overnight (or in a few weeks) to be compatible with ES2022, although they are still compatible with Angular 15 itself.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Just quick ideas:
```
--keep-target-value --keep-use-defined-value
```
and
```json
"targets": {
    "build": {
      "executor": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
      "options": {
          "keepTargetValue": true,
          "keepUseDefinedValue": true
       }
   }
}
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Option to do not override "target" and "useDefineForClassFields"" (#24009)

Issues.Title: 15.0.0-next.2 sets target to ES2022 and project can't be build anymore
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.0.0-next.1

### Description

```
 TypeScript compiler options "target" and "useDefineForClassFields" are set to "ES2022" and "false" respectively by the Angular CLI. To control ECMA version and features use the Browerslist configuration. For more information, see https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist
```

Not every project is ready for ES2022. One example is Leaflet.
Please do not set "target' forcefully, or create some option to turn it off, or please create some small doc page how to control it - https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist has 0 information about it.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Take some project which uses leaflet (better to take some 3-5 years old project).
2. Run `ng serve` or `ng build`

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
15.0.0-next.3
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): Delete 'rename' rule
Issues.Body:
- Delete `rename` rule.
  - This was done based on discussion in this closed PR: #23673.

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [X] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

The `rename` rule exists in the source and is packaged, but is not exposed via the entrypoints.

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?

The `rename` rule is deleted from the source, as it was decided it was no longer wanted.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No

## Other information

Note that the rule can be referenced directly, such as through a statement like this: `import { rename } from '@angular-devkit/schematics/src/rules/rename.js';`. However, since that isn't part of the publicly exposed API, deleting it shouldn't be considered a breaking change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): Delete 'rename' rule" (#24000)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): move more esbuild option setup into normalize option helper
Issues.Body: The initial global stylesheet, file replacement, index HTML, and service worker option analysis and cleanup has now been moved into the `normalizeOptions` helper for the esbuild-based browser application builder. This better organizes the option related setup steps as well as reduces the amount of code in the main builder source file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): move more esbuild option setup into normalize option helper" (#23998)

Issues.Title: bug(Expansion Panel): Lazy rendered panels don't work with ng-content
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using a wrapper component for `mat-expansion-panel` children, using `matExpansionPanelContent` does not seem to work as expected.

I created two components in my example:
- `app-expansion-wrapper`: This contains a `mat-expansion-panel` which renders its child components through `ng-content`. The `ng-content` is wrapped in a `<ng-template matExpansionPanelContent>`
- `app-expansion-child`: This component is to be lazily rendered.__

### Reproduction

Stackblitz example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-szbmmv?file=src/app/expansion-overview-example.html

### Expected Behavior

I would expect the `ngOnInit` from child components not to run until the panel is opened.

### Actual Behavior

The `ngOnInit` from the content wrapped in `matExpansionPanelContent` runs on page load. The component to be lazily loaded logs to the console immediately.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.0
- CDK/Material: 14.2.3
- Browser(s): Tested in FF and Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Expansion Panel): Lazy rendered panels don't work with ng-content" (#25762)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(theming): inconsistent use of blue-grey Sass variable
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

There seems to be a mismatch between the name of a color palette in sections https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#using-a-pre-built-theme and https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#multiple-themes-in-one-file. In the first section, the name `bluegrey` is used in the table (third row, last column). In the second section, the name `blue-grey` is used (as a Sass variable `$blue-grey-palette`). The latter part is a code example, showing the correct variable name.

When looking up the available variables names in the table, using `$bluegrey-palette` would cause an error. This should therefore be changed to the correct `blue-grey` name.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/theming

Issues.Title: bug(mat-icon): material icons are linked just by fonticon attribute
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using material v 14.2.0

Material icons are bound just by attribute `fonticon` which is not created on element when the `mat-icon` directive uses binding in a template by `[fontIcon]='someIconInComponentClass'`

Next - the class for the icon is no more added (was added in version 13)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

`<mat-icon aria-hidden="false" aria-label="Example home icon" [fontIcon]="icon"></mat-icon>`

```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';

/**
 * @title Basic icons
 */
@Component({
  selector: 'icon-overview-example',
  templateUrl: 'icon-overview-example.html',
})
export class IconOverviewExample {
  icon = 'ac_unit';
}
```

### Expected Behavior

working binding of icons (changing in a runtime)

class with icon should be added too

### Actual Behavior

material icons cannot be used with binding

class with icon is not added

### Environment

- Angular: 14.2.0
- CDK/Material: 14.2.0
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): win 10 64b
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-icon): material icons are linked just by fonticon attribute" (#25759)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): Focus trap not working as expected in mobile
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using a screen reader on mobile device such as Voice Over in iOS,
1) on the double tap of the mat-select control, the focus stays on the control instead of focusing on the selected or first element in the panel. Until we manually tab inside the panel. _Please see the attached video 1_.

2) When the focus is inside the panel, on the first option and we swipe backwards (swipe to left), the focus goes to the last element on the page (last element on the footer of the host page). _Please see the attached video 2_.

Though I only documented iOS here, the issue also exists on Android (tested with Pixel 2 + Android 11). In Android swiping in either direction, left  when on the first option and right when on the last option, will cause the focus to leave the panel and enter the content behind while the panel is still open.

Video 1:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13901527/193904148-52b7e842-25e5-44d6-835a-83aeaeecec7b.MOV


Video 2:
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13901527/193904171-b5c59c89-8e8e-4c63-8bc2-b56db659f993.MOV



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. On an iOS Phone, open Safari and visit [https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples](https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples)
2. Turn on Voice Over
3. Use swipes, tab and double tab to interact with one of the mat-select controls and its options panel.

### Expected Behavior

1) With Voice Over turned on, On double tab of the mat-select control, after the drop down panel opens, the selected option or the first option must have being focused.

2) With Voice Over turned on and dropdown panel open, while swaping backwards, the focus must not go into the background content. Focus must either stay in the panel or go to the Safari toolbar (refresh button, back button, etc...).

### Actual Behavior

1) Focus stays on the mat-select control even though the panel has opened.

2) Focus leaves the panel and enters other page content while the panel is still open.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.2.3
- CDK/Material: Mat-Select
- Browser(s): Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS 15.7 and iOS 15.6.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): Focus trap not working as expected in mobile" (#25756)

Issues.Title: feat(DATE): Add Temporal Adapter
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The [Temporal API](https://tc39.es/proposal-temporal/docs/) has been [almost done](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-temporal/issues/1450) for a year now.

Extract from [README.MD](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-temporal):
> NOTE: Although this proposal's API is not expected to change, implementers of this proposal MUST NOT ship unflagged Temporal implementations until IETF standardizes timezone/calendar string serialization formats. See https://github.com/tc39/proposal-temporal/issues/1450 for updates.



### Use Case

If the adapter were created, people could start to experiment with this. Also, the could be THE final adapter to exist. (If temporal lives to meet expectation)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(DATE): Add Temporal Adapter" (#25753)

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): mat-table filter *matNoDataRow with mat-row tag
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hello @angular/material development team!
I really love your product and use it everyday.

But while using mat-table with mat-row, I found that *matNoDataRow with <mat-row/> tag(not <tr/> doesn't work well.
It only shows a blank row eventhough it has content with <mat-cell/> in it.
I think it works with <tr/> and <td/> tags, but while implementing matRipple for the rows, this bug was found.

Please have a look at it and let the users know.

Thanks,
Angular Fan.

### Reproduction

meeting-list.html

```
  ...
      <mat-row *matNoDataRow>
        <mat-cell mat-cell *matCellDef>
          No data matching the filter "{{input.value}}"
        </mat-cell>
      </mat-row>
  ...
```

meeting-list.ts
```
...
  applyFilter(event: Event) {
    const filterValue = (event.target as HTMLInputElement).value;
    this.meetings.filter = filterValue.trim().toLowerCase();

    if (this.meetings.paginator) {
      this.meetings.paginator.firstPage();
    }
  }
...
```

### Expected Behavior

The matNoDataRow should have the content with `No data matching the filter "{{input.value}}"`.

### Actual Behavior

The matNoDataRow should shows only a blank row.

### Environment

- Angular: 14
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(COMPONENT): mat-table filter *matNoDataRow with mat-row tag" (#25752)

Issues.Title: fix(core/mat-option): don't remove aria-selected from deselected options
Issues.Body:
For mat-option, set `aria-selected="false"` on deselected options that are selectable. Conforms with [WAI ARIA Listbox authoring practices guide]( https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/listbox/), which says to always include aria-selected attribute on options that are selectable. Fix issue where voiceover reads every option as "selected" (angular#25736).

Fix angular#25736
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core/mat-option): don't remove aria-selected from deselected options" (#25749)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): changes appearance with box-sizing: border-box
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

A lot of apps (notably the ones using Tailwind) use `* {box-sizing: border-box; }` to default `box-sizing` to `border-box`.
This causes top outline on focused `mat-form-field` with `appearance="outline"` to change appearance around the label when it's floating. It doesn't change much but enough to feel that something's off because the upper-left bit becomes shorter.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36513243/193611594-aeedc640-b82d-47fb-925d-b8306f10a8f5.png)

I assume material is "border-box friendly" because I saw a few similar resolved issues while looking if this has been reported

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use `* {box-sizing: border-box; }`
2. Use `mat-form-field` with `appearance="outline"`

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-jksnnz?file=src/styles.scss

### Expected Behavior

Appearance doesn't change

### Actual Behavior

Appearance changes

### Environment

- Angular: 14.1.3
- CDK/Material: 14.1.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 106.0.5249.91
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): changes appearance with box-sizing: border-box" (#25747)

Issues.Title: fix(material/schematics): files with inline resources overwritten by ng-generate
Issues.Body:
The `ng generate` MDC migration schematics was assuming that `visitTemplate` and `visitStylesheet` will be called only on external resources and it was overwriting the entire file content which was breaking files that have components with inline resources.

These changes edit the file only within the template/stylesheet span.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/schematics): files with inline resources overwritten by ng-generate" (#25744)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): add typography hierarchy to prebuilt
Issues.Body:
Add typography hierarchy back to the prebuilt themes. 

They used to rely on `mat.core` calling `all-component-typographies`, which is equal to `all-component-themes` (with typography in the config) + `typography-hierarchy`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/core): add typography hierarchy to prebuilt" (#25746)

Issues.Title: bug(material/radio): Focus styling remains applied after touch up
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The focus styling of the radio buttons as described in issue 25090 is only fixed on non touch devices and on touch devices, if the button is touched directly. However if the label / text of the button is touched, the focus styling of the radiobutton remains after touch up. 


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. https://material.angular.io/components/radio/overview
2. touch the radio button labels (with a touch device or desktop browser (chrome and edge) set to mobile view/development)

(on firefox the bug is not reproducable with development mobile view / touch emulation, but it is reproducable with a touch win10 device)
(on ios safari the bug is not reproducable)


### Expected Behavior

Remove the focus on touch up, if the label is touched.

### Actual Behavior

The focus remains on touch up on the label.

### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Chrome latest (win and android), egde (win), firefox (physical touch screen / win10)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Win10, Android
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/radio): Focus styling remains applied after touch up" (#25743)
